channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: ANOTHER mattress, bin and rubbish, 5th September
item.description:
Around the corner from the other report is more fly tipping including a blue mattress on the edge of the green space and road

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Evering Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large Graffiti covering a shutter at 296-298 Brixton road SW9 6AG. The graffiti covers both sides of a shutter its against a black background., 5th September
item.description:
Please can something be done to remove graffiti from a shutter. It is very large and only attacts more people to spray on this particular street which we have been having a major problem with recently concerning graffiti. The graffiti is fairly large done against a black background. The graffiti covers both front and side sections of the shutter. The location is 296-298 Brixton road SW9 6AG. The graffiti has been there for over a week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 296,298, Brixton Road, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bickley Lido, 5th September
item.description:
There has been a flooding problem for years just outside the Bickley Train Station. It makes it very dangerous for pedestrians, particularly vulnerable people, elderly and disabled people to get to the station entrance because the water is deep and unsanitary. People are forced to walk in the road into oncoming traffic There is no footpath opposite the flooded side.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southborough Road, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish not collected, 5th September
item.description:
Rubbish was taken put on time but no one picked it up. Its been 3 days in a row now. We had to moved the rubbish to the second collection location.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, D'Arblay Street, Camden Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The lantern on Acrise Cottage on the corner of Well Road and Christchurch Hill, 5th September
item.description:
It hasn’t been working for around a month resulting in the road being very dark. It’s hard to see where you’re walking.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Well Road, Belsize Park, London

item.title: Very large pothole, 5th September
item.description:
The pothole is very large on Danson Crescent. It’s turning into a sinkhole. Half way down the road. As shown on the map.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Crescent, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pigeons get stuck in wires, 5th September
item.description:
On the underside of the bridge there are wires to prevent pigeon nesting which I understand. However, the pigeons somehow get through and nest and find themselves stuck and they suffer greatly. One was stuck struggling to get out for over 24hours. Not sure if it's still there but it's a constant happening. I'm a Lewisham resident in Yeoman Street, so just around the corner and walk under that bridge daily.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Redriff Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A bus hit a street tree, which is now leaning over, 5th September
item.description:
A bus hit part of this tree, and a few nearby residents have expressed concern that the tree is leaning over and looks to be at danger of falling. TfL incident response came and the bus has now been removed but the tree looks hazardous, and one lane of the road (westward direction) is now blocked.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upwood Road, Hither Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Selborne Road, Camberwell, London
